reviews.text: Deadpool & Wolverine will be everything and more to its target audience, but for those that aren't terminally online, there is a good chance half of the movie's jokes and set pieces will be meaningless to them.
reviews.author: Kaitlyn Booth

reviews.text: The first Marvel Cinematic Universe flick to get an R certificate in the US, is, despite that supposed confirmation of mature content, the most relentlessly juvenile entry in a sequence that has rarely been confused with Ingmar Bergman’s Faith trilogy.
reviews.author: Donald Clarke

reviews.text: Neither the quips nor the knowingly over-the-top fight scenes are as lethal as in the earlier pictures, and the film’s wisecracking tone is undercut by the baggage of having to adhere to the MCU’s ungainly overarching narrative.
reviews.author: Tim Grierson

reviews.text: Make no mistake, though, Deadpool and Wolverine is a comedy first; a vulgar, R-rated, often juvenile comedy that provides an abundance of laughs, if for no other reason than it throws out more jokes than any other movie this year.
reviews.author: Jay Ledbetter

reviews.text: With the exception of a few rough edges, Deadpool & Wolverine rises to the occasion as a summer blockbuster spark that could reignite the fervor around the Marvel Cinematic Universe. If future projects keep this up, that could be a great thing.
reviews.author: James Preston Poole

reviews.text: Once Deadpool & Wolverine enters the trash-heap zone, however, it embraces the already meta-aspects of the series to an absurd degree and never looks back.
reviews.author: David Fear

reviews.text: Deadpool & Wolverine is a nerd-gasm of the highest regard making it one of the best in the Marvel, Deadpool, X-Men franchises.
reviews.author: Paul McGuire Grimes

reviews.text: It doesn’t just feel like it’s going through the motions; it feels sad. Like a high school reunion where everyone showed up wearing what they did twenty years ago.
reviews.author: Joonatan Itkonen

reviews.text: Deadpool & Wolverine rescues something kind of beautiful from the ugliness that superhero movies have perpetuated for so long. Not visually, of course, but in several other key respects.
reviews.author: David Ehrlich

reviews.text: Deadpool & Wolverine knows exactly what it is... It doesn’t try to please any naysayers. Instead, Deadpool & Wolverine has too much fun mocking, and celebrating, superhero movie history to worry about winning any one over.
reviews.author: Joe George

reviews.text: If nothing else, Deadpool & Wolverine gives fans reason to be hyped for the Marvel Cinematic Universe's future again. The team-up – not just Ryan and Hugh, but Deadpool and Disney – was worth the anticipation.
reviews.author: Ben Wasserman

reviews.text: The movie jokes about fan service while delivering it.
reviews.author: Fred Topel

reviews.text: Deadpool & Wolverine delivers laughs, nostalgia, and top-notch fan service despite a long setup and a forgettable villain. Reynolds and Jackman's chemistry shines in this R-rated, action-packed Marvel adventure.
reviews.author: Jason Escamilla

reviews.text: I have to say Deadpool & Wolverine was a hilarious and bloody superhero comic that came to life and an excellent time in the movie theater.
reviews.author: Julian Lytle

reviews.text: Deadpool & Wolverine is serviceable in its worst moments and a lot of fun when it’s really cooking. Yet if your expectations for Deadpool & Wolverine include a clean explanation of where the Marvel multiverse stands, perhaps lower them.
reviews.author: Liz Shannon Miller

reviews.text: Serves as both Deadpool’s grand introduction into the Marvel Cinematic Universe, and a touching, sincere, and hilarious send-off to the 20th Century Fox era of superheroes.
reviews.author: Nate Adams

reviews.text: A masterclass in meta-humor, charisma and cameo-chaos, this is a riotous, self-aware spectacle that gleefully mocks superhero conventions while still delivering the adrenaline-pumping action MCU fans having been craving since Avengers: Endgame.
reviews.author: Linda Marric

reviews.text: ‘Deadpool & Wolverine’ humorously diverts in the moment, but as a durable movie or even a long-lasting MCU film, it’s no slam dunk.
reviews.author: Rodrigo Perez

reviews.text: Deadpool & Wolverine is the spark this franchise desperately needed. It’s vulgar, bloody, and violent, and it closes the door on one era of Marvel while opening the door to something that’s been lacking in the MCU for quite some time: optimism.
reviews.author: David Gonzalez

reviews.text: It's pure fan service, so knock off a star if you were after more, but Deadpool & Wolverine knows it's fan service – and it doesn't f**king care.
reviews.author: Ian Sandwell

reviews.text: The foulest, filthiest, fourth wall breaking sequel ever - but at what point are we literally beating the Dead(pool) horse?
reviews.author: Christie Cronan

reviews.text:
Deadpool & Wolverine is about everything I wanted + a little more. 
Entertaining, bloodthirsty, hilarious, & even a shot in the arm to the MCU! 
A refreshing look at the multiverse saga & and entertaining riot. I can't wait to watch again
reviews.author: Zach Pope

reviews.text: A gleefully violent and nostalgia-heavy superhero action-comedy.
reviews.author: Casey Chong

reviews.text: Deadpool & Wolverine is a funny, gory, and meta introduction of/tribute to Fox superheroes by Marvel. It's an absolute blast.
reviews.author: Joey Magidson

reviews.text: ...there are some extraordinarily satisfying and surprising moments in DEADPOOL & WOLVERINE, and they deserve to be experienced fresh...
reviews.author: Alan Cerny

reviews.text: "Deadpool & Wolverine" is a chaotically violent, vulgar, and entertaining time at the movies. It has lots of jokes and amusing set pieces, but it also has a ton of heart behind it, which you can feel coming through all of the actors' performances.
reviews.author: Lauren LaMagna

reviews.text: There are lulls and the film could have used a director with more of a flair for action, but Deadpool & Wolverine is filled with wonderfully crowd-pleasing moments for fans of superhero movies and some truly hysterical jokes.
reviews.author: Eric Goldman

reviews.text: Deadpool & Wolverine keeps the anti-hero’s foul-mouth and blood-soaked tendencies alive for his MCU debut. It’s a shame the story isn’t able to shift the franchise’s slump into a better direction.
reviews.author: Jeff Nelson

reviews.text: As Marvel Studios slows down and reevaluates their superhero landscape, Deadpool & Wolverine shows that there is still plenty of gas left in the tank. Gas that is then poured all over the past and present Marvel filmography and gloriously set ablaze.
reviews.author: Matt Rodriguez

reviews.text: A contender for the best superhero movie ever, Deadpool & Wolverine is two hours of Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman proving they were born to play these roles and, crucially, be part of the MCU. It’s a f***ing masterpiece.
reviews.author: Josh Wilding

reviews.text: The ultimate Marvel movie, a non-stop blockbuster entertainer with a heart of gold. Ryan Reynolds is Marvel Jesus, breathing new life into the MCU and resurrecting the X-Man himself Hugh Jackman for one of the most wildly enjoyable comic book movies ever.
reviews.author: Rohan Patel

reviews.text: 'Deadpool & Wolverine' is the funniest movie of the year and fan service at its most entertaining.
reviews.author: Kyle Wilson

reviews.text: Deadpool & Wolverine settles for manic, gamer-style ultraviolence where death isn’t a thing, really, but where the grotesque sight gags start to feel not simply hollow, but kind of awful.
reviews.author: Michael Phillips

reviews.text: Deadpool & Wolverine operates with a reckless abandon that, through all the bottomless irreverent humor and pizazz on screen, smears its blood and guts from a surprising and corrective place of love.
reviews.author: Don Shanahan

reviews.text: "Deadpool and Wolverine' seems to exist only as Kevin Feige’s desperate attempt to clutch some much needed “we’re so back” from the jaws of “it’s so over” defeat.
reviews.author: Dominic Griffin

reviews.text: This, folks, is maximalist Deadpool, with all the resources of an Avengers team-up tentpole but the same old shameless shtick.
reviews.author: Matt Oakes

reviews.text: It may not be one of the best films of the year, but it is one of the most entertaining. Reynolds brings the laughs, Jackman brings the heart, and the 4th wall breaking nature of the franchise allows it to get away with some multi-verse insanity.
reviews.author: Sean Chandler

reviews.text: I have changed the link to my spoiler review of Deadpool, which also has a link to the non-spoiler review. Both are positive. I added the spoiler review because so many critics seem to be having a hard time understanding the movie. Not that hard.
reviews.author: David Poland

synopsis: Deadpool's peaceful existence comes crashing down when the Time Variance Authority recruits him to help safeguard the multiverse. He soon unites with his would-be pal, Wolverine, to complete the mission and save his world from an existential threat.
